page.title: 03 ADDINGTON MANOR
page.content: Once the property of Lord Addington. The old manor house disappeared long ago. The present building dates from 1857. The church was partly rebuilt in 1858,but the tower and nave arcades remain in the Decorated style.The Manor is now owned by Lord Inchcape.The Countess Inchcape runs a dressage schoo for horses on the estate.A very fine example of a tithe barn remains near the stable block,now converted in to flats.The old stocks may still be seen. The school buildings is now a private house.
